results.title: Danke schoen
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI secondary school media festival.
A claymation short features an older man walking along a street. He is pleased to find an old jukebox with one of his favorite songs in it. He puts a coin in the slot, but needs to insert more money. Not finding any in his pocket, he finds a bottle top on the street, picks it up and pops it into the coin slot, but the jukebox still requires more money. He decides to take off his pincenez and his nose and proceeds to put them into the jukebox, but alas, still not enough money. He proceeds to take his ears off and thankfully the machine starts to play…but can he hear the music?!

results.title: The Great American cowboy
results.creator_credit: Keith Merrill and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: An “in-the-arena” look at a rodeo that gives viewers a spectacular perspective of the life of today’s cowboys and follows the year-long championships quest of two competitors.

results.title: Barry and the psycho doorstop salesman
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This work depicts an animated character, Barry, bored with commercial television. He happily accepts a video game sold to him by an overzealous door to door salesman. Barry becomes enraged when he finds that the game does not work and complains to the salesman the following day. Barry has made a big mistake…as the psychotic salesman stalks Barry and a violent tussle ensues in the dead of night. Barry finally finishes killing the salesman…or has he??

group_siblings.title: The Adventures of Buzz Boy & Buzz Girl
The good, the bad and the animated

results.title: The Adventures of Buzz Boy & Buzz Girl
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This animated short depicts the adventures between an evil bee and super hero insects. Dr. Bee has hypnotised Buzz Boy to steal for him, after poisoning a peanut and jelly sandwich. Buzz Girl finds out the truth and informs Buzz Boy. Together they set out in search of Dr.Bee. They find him and are caught up in a high speed chase which eventuates in Dr.Bee crashing into the side of a skyscraper.

group_siblings.title: Barry and the psycho doorstop salesman
The good, the bad and the animated

results.title: The Great Canadian train ride
results.brief_description: In 1955 the Canadian Pacific Railway inaugurated the ‘Canadian’, a new train designed to offer the ultimate in rail luxury. It was then and remains today one of the longest train journeys in the world. VIA Rail took on the daunting task of restoring all of the original lounge Park Cars, the observation dome cars and the dining and sleeping cars. The restored cars are now in service on the northern route of the Super Continental. Doug Jones boards the train in Toronto and documents its journey to Vancouver across Canada. A history of the Canadian Pacific Railway is given, as well as a behind the scenes look at the operations of the train. Doug Jones also looks at tourist destinations along the way.

results.title: The Grass is singing
results.creator_credit: Michael Raeburn, Mark Forstater, Svenska filminstitutet and Chibote Ltd
results.brief_description: Set against the overwhelming African bush, Karen Black as Mary Turner plays a desperate woman searching for security and love. Unable to come to terms with herself or the land she lives in, Mary accepts a marriage proposal from farmer John Thaw, rather than remain single in a big city. But this is not the escape she hoped it to be. Based on the novel by Doris Lessing.

results.title: The Great Canadian shield
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The rock of the great Canadian Shield was formed two billion years ago. Now its many minerals—gold, nickel, copper, mica, feldspar, iron and magnesium—are mined as essential ingredients in Canadian industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Great artesian basin
results.creator_credit: Tim Sullivan, Ron Saunders and Filmhouse
results.brief_description: This film explains the geological process whereby the Great Artesian Basin was formed. It explains how artesian wells function.

results.title: The Goodies and the beanstalk
results.creator_credit: Bob Spiers, Jim Franklin, J.H. Davies and BBC
results.brief_description: They’ll do anything, anytime, anywhere - and they’ve got the bike to prove it. Here are three episodes of classic high-brow comedy starring Tim Brooke-Taylor, Bill Oddie and Graeme Garden. THE GOODIES AND THE BEANSTALK: Cricklewood, 1973: poverty stricken, the Goodies sell their tandem for a tin of beans - which, when planted, grows into a giant beanstalk leading up Mt Everest to the giant’s castle where golden eggs are laid. But before the Goodies can become rich, they must battle with the Giant. Note: this is the 43 minute Christmas version. Guest stars Michael Aspel. THE END: The office is entombed under a pillar of concrete in line with Graeme’s new city development plan. Isolated, the Goodies explore their relationships with each other, politics, religion and eye-spy. THE BUNFIGHT AT THE O.K. TEA ROOMS: The Goodies go west (well, Cornwall) to mine for gold, but strike cream instead. Graeme monopolises the cream business by sneaking off on the other two, but Tim and Bill also find strawberry jam and scones. The stakes are set for a poker game where winner takes all, and culminates in the Bunfight at the O.K. Tea Rooms.
